snippet: The release of Jonas Carpignano’s film about two young men who made the harrowing journey from North Africa to Europe is well timed.
abstract: Jonas Carpignano draws inspiration for his first full-length feature film, Mediterranea, from plight of Burkina Faso natives who make perilous journey for better life, but end up facing racism and other challenges after settling in Italy; Carpignano, nominated for Gotham Independent Film Award for best breakthrough director, says his movie about plight of economic migrants presents stark look at Europe’s evolving humanitarian crisis.
lead_paragraph: The release of Jonas Carpignano’s film about two young men who made the harrowing journey from North Africa to Europe is well timed.

headline.main: In ‘Mediterranea,’ Two Migrants Speak for Many
headline.print_headline: In a Film, Two Migrants Speak for Many

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
